ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: Many models contain tuning parameters (i.e. parameters that cannot be directly estimated from the data). These tools can be used to define objects for creating, simulating, or validating values for such parameters.

Many models contain tuning parameters (i.e. parameters that cannot be directly estimated from the data). These tools can be used to define objects for creating, simulating, or validating values for such parameters.

name: r-dials
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "1.4.2" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-dials
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/dials_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/dials/dials_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 08aa4735616ec24bd7b066518f607535ce97fa78b1aab2f29df24d9ac435df42

build:
  number: 1
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-dicedesign
    - r-cli
    - r-dplyr >=0.8.5
    - r-glue
    - r-hardhat >=1.1.0
    - r-lifecycle
    - r-pillar
    - r-purrr
    - r-rlang >=1.1.0
    - r-scales >=1.3.0
    - r-sfd
    - r-tibble
    - r-vctrs >=0.3.8
    - r-withr
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-dicedesign
    - r-cli
    - r-dplyr >=0.8.5
    - r-glue
    - r-hardhat >=1.1.0
    - r-lifecycle
    - r-pillar
    - r-purrr
    - r-rlang >=1.1.0
    - r-scales >=1.3.0
    - r-sfd
    - r-tibble
    - r-vctrs >=0.3.8
    - r-withr

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('dials')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('dials')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://tidymodels.github.io/dials
  license: MIT
  summary: Many models contain tuning parameters (i.e. parameters that cannot be directly estimated from the data). These tools can be used to define objects for creating, simulating, or validating values for such parameters.
  license_family: MIT
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/MIT
    - LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - philip-khor

# Package: dials
# Version: 0.0.3
# Title: Tools for Creating Tuning Parameter Values
# Description: Many models contain tuning parameters (i.e. parameters that cannot be directly estimated from the data). These tools can be used to define objects for creating, simulating, or validating values for such parameters.
# Authors@R: c( person(given = "Max", family = "Kuhn", email = "max@rstudio.com", role = c("aut", "cre")), person("RStudio", role = "cph"))
# License: GPL-2
# URL: https://tidymodels.github.io/dials
# BugReports: https://github.com/tidymodels/dials/issues
# Encoding: UTF-8
# LazyData: true
# ByteCompile: true
# RoxygenNote: 6.1.1
# VignetteBuilder: knitr
# Depends: scales, R (>= 2.10)
# Imports: glue, purrr, tibble, rlang, utils, withr, DiceDesign, dplyr
# Suggests: testthat, knitr, rpart, covr, kernlab, xml2
# NeedsCompilation: no
# Packaged: 2019-10-01 00:25:51 UTC; max
# Author: Max Kuhn [aut, cre], RStudio [cph]
# Maintainer: Max Kuhn <max@rstudio.com>
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2019-10-01 05:00:02 UTC
